Player History
Had first career hit on 4/7/1985, off Rick Honeycutt (LAD)...
Injured on 5/30/1985 with a Dislocated Shoulder, out for 2 weeks...
Traded from St. Louis to Chicago on 7/31/1985 (Going to STL: C Jody Davis, 1B Leon Durham. Going to CHC: C Tom Pagnozzi, C Carlton Fisk, CF Brian Harper)...
2/2/1986: Gets a new one-year contract worth $350,000 through salary arbitration...
Hit first career homerun on 5/6/1986, off Bob Walk (PIT)...
7/20/1986: Signed a contract extension with Chicago, $640,000 per year, for 3 years.
Was selected to the 1989 Allstar game...
Signed as a free agent by Chicago on 3/4/1990 to a 1-year deal worth $1,484,000 per year...
Released by Chicago on 4/26/1990...
Signed as a free agent by Atlanta on 6/16/1990 to a 1-year deal worth $1,356,000 per year...
8/3/1990: Signed a contract extension with Atlanta, $2,500,000 per year, for 4 years.
Won Player of the Week award on 9/18/1991, hitting .600 with 2 HR, 5 RBI...
